title.narrative: Expansion of the national business registration system (NBRS) to new business entities

description.narrative: Following up on prior successful UNIDO assistance co-funded by SECO, NORAD, UNIDO, and the ONE UN Fund Viet Nam since 2008, in establishing a National Business Registration System (NBRS), the project will expand and consolidate existing results. By August 2018, the Agency for Business Registration (ABR) and Business Registration Offices (BROs) in 63 provinces of the country will be enabled to provide accurate, legally binding information on commercial entities to the business community, government agencies and the general public, independently from similar further international donor support. UNIDO will primary assist the ABR and BROs in expanding the coverage of the existing NBRS, established under the former project entitled Technical Assistance to Business Registration Reform, to other types of businesses. UNIDO's support to the ABR and BROs will focus on legal advice, institution building, technical upgrading of the NBRS, capacity building of staff, including on enhanced client orientation in service provision and support in conducting public awareness raising campaigns. UNIDO is today the only development agency working specially on Business Registration Reform (BRR) in Viet Nam.
